com.hds.aw.auto.reportingApi.sdk

Class ReportingAPIClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hds.aw.auto.reportingApi.sdk.ReportingAPIHttpClient
      • com.hds.aw.auto.reportingApi.sdk.ReportingAPIClient

  • public class ReportingAPIClient
extends ReportingAPIHttpClient
    Class that contains authentication information and has HTTP methods. Every report uses object of this class to make HTTP calls to the server. When instantiate new instance of this class, it will authenticate first and store the auth token.

    • Method Detail

      • updateClientAuthToken

        public void updateClientAuthToken()
                           throws ReportingAPISDKException
        Update auth token of the client.
        Throws:
        ReportingAPISDKException

      • getAuthToken

        public static ReportingAPIAuthToken getAuthToken(java.lang.String hostName,
                                                 ReportingAPIVersion apiVersion,
                                                 java.lang.String username,
                                                 java.lang.String password,
                                                 java.lang.String uniqueId,
                                                 java.lang.String clientVersion,
                                                 java.lang.String clientNickname)
                                          throws ReportingAPISDKException
        Static method to get an auth token of the Reporting API.
        Parameters:
        hostName - Hostname or ip address of the HCP Anywhere system.
        apiVersion - Version of the Reporting API that is used. Use enum defined in ReportingAPIVersion for this parameter.
        username - Username of the user. The user must has audit role if wants to access audit reports and admin role if wants to access admin reports.
        password - Password of the user.
        uniqueId - A string that is unique to the client running the Reporting API. The uniqueID is used to differentiate between two clients running the reporting API simultaneously with the same authorization token. For example, "uniqueId".
        clientVersion - A string represents version of the client. For example, "2.1.0.0".
        clientNickname - A string used to identify the client. For example, "Reporting API SDK".
        Returns:
        ReportingAPIAuthToken object that represents an auth token.
        Throws:
        ReportingAPISDKException

      • getAuthTokenResponse

        public static com.hds.auto.commons.util.http.ResponseObj<ReportingAPIAuthToken> getAuthTokenResponse(java.lang.String hostName,
                                                                                                     ReportingAPIVersion apiVersion,
                                                                                                     java.lang.String username,
                                                                                                     java.lang.String password,
                                                                                                     java.lang.String uniqueId,
                                                                                                     java.lang.String clientVersion,
                                                                                                     java.lang.String clientNickname)
                                                                                              throws ReportingAPISDKException
        Static method to get response that contains auth token information.
        Parameters:
        hostName - Hostname or ip address of the HCP Anywhere system.
        apiVersion - Version of the Reporting API that is used. Use enum defined in ReportingAPIVersion for this parameter.
        username - Username of the user. The user must has audit role if wants to access audit reports and admin role if wants to access admin reports.
        password - Password of the user.
        uniqueId - A string that is unique to the client running the Reporting API. The uniqueID is used to differentiate between two clients running the reporting API simultaneously with the same authorization token. For example, "uniqueId".
        clientVersion - A string represents version of the client. For example, "2.1.0.0".
        clientNickname - A string used to identify the client. For example, "Reporting API SDK".
        Returns:
        ResponseObj object contains a ReportingAPIAuthToken instance.
        Throws:
        ReportingAPISDKException
